parameter-group.name: serialPortAdvanced
parameter-group.label: Manual Serial Port Settings
parameter-group.description: In case auto detection fails, it is possible to specify the Serial Port manually

parameter.name: serialPort
parameter.label: Serial Port
parameter.description: The Serial Port where the P1 port of the Smart Meter is connected (e.g. Linux: /dev/ttyUSB0, Windows: COM1)

parameter.name: serialPortDisableAutoDetection
parameter.label: Disable Serial Port auto detection
parameter.description: In case auto detection of the DSMR-device does not work it is possible to disable auto detection and use the manual Serial port parameters.

parameter.name: serialPortBaudrate
parameter.label: Serial Port baud rate
parameter.description: Specify the Serial Port baud rate.

parameter.name: serialPortDatabits
parameter.label: Serial Port data bits
parameter.description: Specify the Serial Port data bits.

parameter.name: serialPortStopbits
parameter.label: Serial Port stop bits
parameter.description: Specify the Serial Port stop bits.

parameter.name: lenientMode
parameter.label: Lenient Mode
parameter.description:
In lenient mode the binding will handle communication problems more silently. If your experiencing lots of errors in the log and receive no data setting lenient mode to true could help.

Please note that receiving data is not steady (the communication problems are still there).

This option could be needed for embedded platforms and should not be needed if the platform fast enough.

parameter.name: channel
parameter.label: Channel
parameter.description:
The DSMR-device channel for this meter (M-Bus channel). The binding will auto detect this value.
In normal situations it is not necessary to adapt this value.

If the auto detection failed or if physical changes are made to the meter setup (changed water, gas, heating) meters it can be necessary to update the M-Bus channel.
